text:
Has anyone seen this? The REPL responds to the _previous_ command?

`julia> 10`
`2`

`julia> 1+1`
`10`

`julia> 10+10`
`2`

`julia> 100*100`
`20`

`julia> exp(10)`
`10000`

`julia> 10`
`22026.465794806718`

elements.text: Has anyone seen this? The REPL responds to the

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
did you define `+` in some weird ways?
julia computes so fast the repl can't keep up with it

text: Mine occasionally does this, usually when I’ve really confused Revise somehow. Never managed to make it reproducible though.

text: I believe it happens for some very old Revise versions (like 1.X).  Are you using Revise? And if so, are you using version 3.x?

elements.text: I believe it happens for some very old Revise versions (like 1.X).  Are you using Revise? And if so, are you using version 3.x?

text: It may not have happened in quite a few months, haven’t tried to keep track. I was using the terminal inside Sublime Text a lot, not sure if this contributed.

text:
Oops sorry I see my previous "replies" should have been here:

No, pretty sure I didn't do something evil like that. I've shut down the instance it was happening and the problem's not surprisingly gone away. I was having some threads-related problems (bugs in my code)
. Perhaps that was related...

and

Yes I am using Revise, but a recent version. And it was the built in REPL in VSCode

text: It sometimes happens after code changes that Revise can't revise properly, e.g. if you save a tracked file with an unfinished function
